question: 肝
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well. Though, it also means <vocabulary>chutzpah</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>courage</vocabulary> (besides just being <vocabulary>liver</vocabulary>). Maybe your liver is where your courage is.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you to remember: Your <vocabulary>liver</vocabulary> isn't doing great. You have cancer in your liver, so now they're giving you <reading>chemo</reading> (<ja>きも</ja>) to help get rid of that cancer.
